fault.symptom: No normal signals are received from the crankshaft position sensor.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Defective crankshaft position sensor. - Malfunction in pickup rotor. - Malfunction in ECU. - Improperly installed sensor.

step.item: Installed condition of crankshaft position sensor.
Connections: Crankshaft position sensor coupler, Main wire harness ECU coupler
step.check: Check the coupler for any pins that may be pulled out. Check the locking condition of the coupler. If there is a malfunction, repair it and connect the coupler securely.

step.item: Open or short circuit in wire harness.
step.check: Repair or replace if there is an open or short circuit. Between the crankshaft position sensor coupler and ECU coupler (gray–gray)(black/blue–black/blue)
Replace if defective. Refer to “CHECKING THE CRANKSHAFT POSITION SENSOR” on page 7-100.

fault.symptom: Cylinder-#1 intake air pressure sensor: open or short circuit detected.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Defective cylinder-#1 intake air pressure sensor. - Malfunction in ECU.

fault.symptom: Cylinder-#1 intake air pressure sensor: hose system malfunction (clogged or detached hose).
fault.probableCause: - Cylinder-#1 intake air pressure sensor hose is detached, clogged, kinked, or pinched. - Malfunction in ECU.

fault.symptom: Throttle position sensor: open or short circuit detected.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire sub lead. - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Defective throttle position sensor. - Malfunction in ECU. - Improperly installed throttle position sensor.

fault.symptom: EXUP servo motor circuit: open or short circuit detected.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Defective EXUP servo motor (potentiometer circuit).

fault.symptom: EXUP servo motor is stuck.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Stuck EXUP servo motor (mechanism). - Stuck EXUP servo motor (motor).

fault.symptom: A break or disconnection of the blue/yellow lead of the ECU is detected.
fault.probableCause: - Open circuit in wire harness (ECU coupler). - Malfunction in ECU.

fault.symptom: Air temperature sensor: open or short circuit detected.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Defective air temperature sensor. - Malfunction in ECU. - Improperly installed air temperature sensor.

fault.symptom: No normal signal is received from the O2 sensor.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Defective O2 sensor. - Malfunction in ECU. - Improperly installed sensor.

fault.symptom: Cylinder-#2 intake air pressure sensor: open or short circuit detected.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Defective cylinder-#2 intake air pressure sensor. - Malfunction in ECU.

fault.symptom: Cylinder-#2 intake air pressure sensor: hose system malfunction (clogged or detached hose).
fault.probableCause: - Cylinder-#2 intake air pressure sensor hose is detached, clogged, kinked, or pinched. - Malfunction in ECU.

fault.symptom: Engine temperature sensor: open or short circuit detected.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire sub lead. - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Defective engine temperature sensor. - Malfunction in ECU. - Improperly installed sensor.

fault.symptom: Decompression solenoid (thermistor): open or short circuit detected.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Defective decompression solenoid (thermistor). - Malfunction in ECU. - Improperly installed sensor.

fault.symptom: The vehicle has overturned.
fault.probableCause: - Overturned. - Malfunction in ECU.

fault.symptom: Malfunction detected in the primary wire of the cylinder-#1 left or right ignition coil.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire sub lead. - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Malfunction in cylinder-#1 left or right ignition coil. - Malfunction in ECU. - Malfunction in a component of ignition cut-off circuit system.

fault.symptom: Malfunction detected in the primary wire of the cylinder-#2 left ignition coil.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Malfunction in cylinder-#2 left ignition coil. - Malfunction in ECU. - Malfunction in a component of ignition cut-off circuit system.

fault.symptom: Malfunction detected in the primary wire of the cylinder-#1 left or right ignition coil.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire sub lead. - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Malfunction in cylinder-#1 left or right ignition coil. - Malfunction in ECU. - Malfunction in a component of ignition cut-off circuit system.

fault.symptom: Malfunction detected in the primary wire of the cylinder-#2 right ignition coil.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Malfunction in cylinder-#2 right ignition coil. - Malfunction in ECU. - Malfunction in a component of ignition cut-off circuit system.

fault.symptom: Engine speed is high when the engine is idling.
fault.probableCause: - Open circuit in wire harness. - Malfunction in throttle body. - Malfunction in throttle cables. - ISC valve is stuck fully open. - Malfunction in ECU. - ECU fuse is blown.

fault.symptom: Decompression solenoid: open or short circuit detected.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Defective decompression solenoid. - Malfunction in ECU. - Improperly installed sensor.

fault.symptom: Lean angle cut-off switch: open or short circuit detected.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Defective lean angle cut-off switch. - Malfunction in ECU.

fault.symptom: A. No normal signals are received from the speed sensor. B. Open circuit is detected in the neutral switch.
fault.probableCause: - Open circuit in wire harness. - Defective speed sensor/neutral switch. - Malfunction in ECU.

fault.symptom: The ECU is unable to monitor the battery voltage (an open or short circuit in the line to the ECU).
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Malfunction in ECU.

fault.symptom: Error is detected while reading or writing on EEPROM (CO adjustment value).
fault.probableCause: - Malfunction in ECU. (The CO adjustment value is not properly written on or read from the internal memory).

fault.symptom: Power supply to the fuel injection system is not normal.
fault.probableCause: Malfunction in the charging system. Refer to “CHARGING SYSTEM” on page 7-11.

fault.symptom: Faulty ECU memory. (When this malfunction is detected in the ECU, the fault code number might not appear on the meter.)
fault.probableCause: - Malfunction in ECU. (The program and data are not properly written on or read from the internal memory.)

fault.symptom: Muffler cooling fan temperature sensor: open or short circuit detected.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Defective muffler cooling fan temperature sensor. - Malfunction in ECU. - Improperly installed sensor.

fault.symptom: Engine trouble warning light is flashing. (Abnormally high temperature is detected by muffler cooling fan temperature sensor.)
fault.probableCause: - Muffler cover fan fuse or ECU fuse is blown. - Defective muffler cooling fan temperature sensor or motor relay. - Deformed parts near sensor.

fault.symptom: No signals are received from the ECU.
fault.probableCause: - Open or short circuit in wire harness. - Malfunction in meter. - Malfunction in ECU. - Defective wire connection of the ECU coupler.

fault.symptom: No signals are received from the ECU within the specified duration.
fault.probableCause: - Improper connection in wire harness. - Malfunction in meter. - Malfunction in ECU.

fault.symptom: Data from the ECU cannot be received correctly.
fault.probableCause: - Improper connection in wire harness. - Malfunction in meter. - Malfunction in ECU.

fault.symptom: Non-registered data has been received from the meter.
fault.probableCause: - Improper connection in wire harness. - Malfunction in meter. - Malfunction in ECU.

sensor.meterDisplay: Displays the cylinder-#1 intake air pressure.
sensor.checkingMethod: Set engine stop switch to "run", then operate throttle while pushing start switch.

sensor.meterDisplay: Displays the cylinder-#2 intake air pressure.
sensor.checkingMethod: Set engine stop switch to "run", then operate throttle while pushing start switch.
Compare the actually measured air temperature with the meter display value.
Check that the number increases when the rear wheel is rotated. The number is cumulative and does not reset each time the wheel is stopped.
Remove the lean angle cut-off switch and incline it more than 65 degrees.
Set the engine stop switch to "run", and then compare with the actually measured battery voltage. (If the battery voltage is lower, perform recharging.)
Compare the actually measured engine temperature with the meter display value.

sensor.meterDisplay: Displays the muffler cooling fan temperature.
sensor.checkingMethod: Compare the actually measured muffler cooling fan temperature with the meter display value.

sensor.meterDisplay: Stand retracted: ON, Stand extended: OFF
sensor.checkingMethod: Set ON/OFF the Sidestand switch. (with the transmission in gear.)

sensor.meterDisplay: Displays the operating angle. Engine trouble warning light comes on twice: once when the EXUP valve is closing and once when it is opening.
No history: 00. History exists: 01 or 02 (Cylinder fault code)
No history: 00. History exists: Fault codes 12-63
No history: 0. History exists: Up to 28 fault codes
sensor.checkingMethod: To erase the history, set the engine stop switch to "run".

actuator.item: Cylinder-#1 left or right ignition coil
actuator.actuation: Actuates for five times every second. Illuminates warning light.
actuator.checkingMethod: Check the spark five times. Connect an ignition checker.

actuator.actuation: Actuates for five times every second. Illuminates warning light.
actuator.checkingMethod: Check the spark five times. Connect an ignition checker.

actuator.item: Cylinder-#1 left or right ignition coil
actuator.actuation: Actuates for five times every second. Illuminates warning light.
actuator.checkingMethod: Check the spark five times. Connect an ignition checker.

actuator.actuation: Actuates for five times every second. Illuminates warning light.
actuator.checkingMethod: Check the spark five times. Connect an ignition checker.

actuator.actuation: Actuates for five times every second. Illuminates warning light.
actuator.checkingMethod: Check the operating sound of the injector #1 five times.

actuator.actuation: Actuates for five times every second. Illuminates warning light.
actuator.checkingMethod: Check the operating sound of the injector #2 five times.

actuator.actuation: Actuates for five times every second. Illuminates warning light.
actuator.checkingMethod: Check the operating sound of the intake solenoid five times.

actuator.actuation: Actuates the fuel pump relay for five times every second. Illuminates the engine trouble warning light.
actuator.checkingMethod: Check the operating sound of the fuel pump relay five times.

actuator.actuation: Actuates the muffler cooling fan motor relay for five cycles of five seconds. Illuminates the engine trouble warning light.
actuator.checkingMethod: Check the operating sound of the muffler cooling fan motor relay five times.

actuator.actuation: Actuates the headlight relay for five cycles of five seconds. Illuminates the engine trouble warning light.
actuator.checkingMethod: Check the operating sound of the headlight relay five times.

actuator.actuation: Actuates and fully closes the ISC valve, then opens it to the standby opening position when the engine is started. Illuminates the engine trouble warning light.
actuator.checkingMethod: The ISC unit vibrates when the ISC valve operates.

actuator.actuation: Actuates the decompression solenoid for five cycles of five seconds. Illuminates the engine trouble warning light.
actuator.checkingMethod: Check the operating sound of the decompression solenoid five times. NOTE: Disconnect the starter motor lead before performing this procedure.
